Rated: Guidance Suggested. This skill contains: dynamic content.
Invocation Name: vesync
des:
To get started, select the 'Enable Skill' button in the Alexa App to link your VeSync account and discover your devices. Find more information about connecting smart home devices at http://amzn.to/2p0hsKg.

First. Use Alexa to control your smart device
When using the function, you need established names for your devices. There are two ways to define these names:
 Use the names you previously set up. They are shown in the VeSync app and can be changed
 Create an Alexa group, like Bedroom or Downstairs, and add the device to the group. More information is available at http://amzn.to/2pIe1Vq.

Once you know the device name or group name for your devices, you can say the following :
 "Alexa, turn on the air purifier."
 "Alexa, turn off the air purifier.”

Second. Use Alexa to query health data
Before using this function, You need to use a body scale or a blood pressure monitor to record your body information or log your measurements in the Vesync app.
If you have any health records, You can ask VeSync these statements to get your health data quickly:
 "Alexa, ask VeSync what‘s my weight."
 "Alexa, ask VeSync what is my current Muscle mass.”
 "Alexa, ask VeSync what's my latest blood pressure reading."

Third. Use Alexa to control your device
Please use the Smart home skill for North American devices, and the Custom skill for European devices
Before using this function, You need use to configure your device in the Vesync app.
If you have configured the device and renamed it, you can control the device quickly:
 "Alexa, ask VeSync Cook steak in the Smart Air Fryer.” 
 "Alexa, ask VeSync Add two minutes to the Smart Air Fryer."

Note: you cannot do device control and data query at the same time. After waking up the health data query skill, you need to wait for the entire session to end before waking up the device control.

If you have any questions, please visit the VeSync FAQ at https://files.vesync.com/h5/newHelp/alexa-en.html.
